page.title: 06RELIGION IN IGHTHAM
page.content: The {Lychgate}was built in 1912. Carved into the wood is written "In memory of{A.W.M, E.M., H.M., J.M.} Erected by{ Ada.F.Barry".} Rectors have serviced here from{ {1232.}The{Rev.J.H.B.Talbot}is the 43rd}rector. The church was built in the early{12th}century, but was entirely rebuilt in the{14th}and{15th} centuries. The oldest bell dates back to{ {1430.}The most recent one was put in, in{1888. { }The oak doors in the{southwest } porch date back to{1552.} The Jacobean bowpews were made by local craftsmen for the{James'}family of{Ightham Court.}They were used by the family for three hundred years. The oldest memorial inside the Church is one for{Sir Thomas Cawne.
